item.title: Report I-2025010008
item.description:
Report I-2025010008

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: American Airlines received a fibreboard box that contained AA aircraft parts in Charlotte (CL T) from Shipper of a MRO, VT Mobile Aerospace (BFM) which contained a styrofoam box and inside was a Oxygen Generator Panel, which had a live chemical oxygen generator and 4 masks inside the panel. The styrofoam box was insidea non spec fibreboard box, where several other aircraft parts that were non hazardous. No marks, labels, packaging or communication for hazardous materials was found.

item.title: Report E-2025020021
item.description:
Report E-2025020021

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-01
  • City: BISCOE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver connected the Consignee's hose that leads into the storage tank. He noticed the hose gasket did not look good and replaced the gasket. There were no issues initially with the unload. The driver the unload area unattended to use the restroom. Upon returning to the trailer, the hose was leaking at the location of the replaced gasket. 200 gallons of product released. The Release impacted an area of 5’X50’ on concrete and asphalt. No soil or drains were impacted. Area was pressure-washed and the water was collected for disposal.
